# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

In Julia, you can use the `lowercase`, `replace` and `strip` functions to clean a string as per your requirements. Here's how you can define the `clean_column` function:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String) :: String
    col = lowercase(col)
    col = replace(col, ' ' => '_')
    col = replace(col, '-' => '_')
    return strip(col)
end
```
This function takes a string `col` as input and applies the `lowercase`, `replace` and `strip` functions to it. The `lowercase` function converts all characters in the string to lowercase. The `replace` functions replace all spaces and hyphens with underscores. The `strip` function removes leading and trailing whitespaces from the string. The cleaned column name is then returned by the function. 

Here's how you can use this function:

```julia
julia> col = " My Column-Name  "
" My Column-Name  "

julia> clean_column(col)
"my_column_name"
```
